article_title: S&P Upgrades Ireland by One Notch to A-Minus
article_text:
Standard & Poor's on Friday said it upgraded Ireland's government bonds by one notch to A-minus, saying the country is making good progress in getting a grip on its six-year banking-debt crisis.

It marks the first major upgrade of Ireland by S&P after it downgraded the country at the height of the economic ills, in 2011. As the worst of the crisis eased, it subsequently lifted its Ireland outlook to positive. And Friday, S&P said it increased its rating to A-minus from BBB+, as a brighter economic outlook has...
